title: The American Compendium of British Crimes
description: Britain has suffered many appalling crimes.All countries have their own monsters.The American Compendium of British Crimes presents thestories of the 27 most notorious crimes—or series ofcrimes—in modern British history, taking us from theearly 19th century right up to the present day. The intention is to inform an American audience not onlyof the criminal history of this country but also to revealsomething of its cultural nature.For as Virgil told from a single crime know thenation . . .
author: William Ruby
